item.title: RA
item.description:
Basic terminologies:

  • Dimensions
  • Facts

Table and table naming conventions

  • initial 3 letter prefix: DWH, ODS etc.
  • Content: e.g. PRD, SLS
  • Dimension or Fact: D, F
  • Granularity : Department, day/week etc.
  • Suffix as use case: Lookup vs Base Vs Aggregate vs Matrix
  • Naming: data region + dimension_or_fact + content + granularity + usage

Column naming:

  • Naming: Attribute or measure + data type
  • Attribute: Price etc.
  • Data type: KEY, ID, DESC
  • Maintenance columns: insert timestamp, update, close, close_dt
  • Business calendar: 4-4-5 or 4-5-4 or 5-4-4 and 13 period calendar.
  • Matrices are designated with MTX suffix.

Dimension Tables:

  • Examples of naming:
    • DWH_D_TIM_YR_LU : data warehouse, dimension table, timestamp, year, Lookup
    • CURR_TIM : curr timestamp

  • Some examples

item.title: ODI
item.description:
• Full package for ETL
  • Automation tool: UC4
  • RMS Server
  • Database
    • These work together; ODI isn’t standalone.
    • All stuffs may be installed in the same RMS server.

Jobs

  • Handled by (ksh) scripts to run different jobs

UC4

  • Scheduler
  • Agent: defined in uc4 to connect to RMS server.
    • defines path of scripts

ODI agent

  • Connect between server & ODI
  • Can also automate UC4 tasks in newer versions.

Architecture

Design

  • Mapping
  • Transform
  • Making of Project

Operator

  • Logging
  • Status of jobs

Topology

  • Defining connections : physical and logical
  • Physical connections ==> Mapped to logical connections
  • Data model ==> Map table columns to table columns and so on.

  • Data Models

item.title: Warehouse
item.description:
Basic terminologies:

Dimensions Facts

Table and table naming conventions

initial 3 letter prefix: DWH, ODS etc. Content: e.g. PRD, SLS Dimension or Fact: D, F Granularity : Department, day/week etc. Suffix as use case: Lookup vs Base Vs Aggregate vs Matrix Naming: data region + dimension_or_fact + content + granularity + usage

Column naming:

Naming: Attribute or measure + data type Attribute: Price etc. Data type: KEY, ID, DESC

  • Maintenance columns: insert timestamp, update, close, close_dt

item.title: obiee
item.description:
Steps

  • Catalog –> Get to columns and filters.
  • Change defaults tab to criteria
  • save as
  • give a proper name for result
  • change all columns and filters as necessary.
  • save again
  • go to results then.
  • export results. if > 2500 : export to csv.
  • Edit the sheet

RMS Sales recon

Tran data

  • In tran_data we have item, units, tran_code as major fields.
  • if it belongs to a pack, then it has a ref_pack_no which is a packitem object.

Packitem

  • It has pack_no and seq_no as main fields: seq_no for multiple items in a pack and make it unique.
  • it has item inside it
  • item_parent if available.
  • either item has to be there or item_parent has to be there. Both can’t be null.
  • pack_qty has quantity of items.

Packitem breakout

  • pack may contain a pack, if so the nested pack and it’s items are inside packitem breakout table.
  • similar to packitem
  • COMP_PACK_NO: Contains the inner pack item number if a pack item is added to an outer pack.
  • COMP_PACK_QTY: This field is null if comp_pack_no is not populated. Else if comp_pack_no is

populated then this field contains the quantity of comp_pack_no in a pack_no.
